info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 4:39PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Windsor, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Windsor, Colerain, Rockyhock, Cape Colony, Valhalla, Midway, Askewville, Goose Pond, Whites Crossroads, Merry Hill, Arrowhead Beach, Edenhouse, Republican, Trap, Mount Gould, Hancock, Quitsna, Wakelon, Woodard and Rosemead. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
